edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.prog_game

Class PowerUp

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.csupomona.cs.cs141.prog_game.PowerUp
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Invince, PlusAmmo, Radar

    public abstract class PowerUp
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class is an abstract class that contains the methods in common that all of the power up items will have. Creating this class was easier then writing 3 versions of the same thing.
    Author:
    Phil Sloan, Dale Kim, Hagop B.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getLocation()
      This method will return the x,y location of the Player object as a single integer between 1-81, where 1-9 is the first row, 10-18 is the second and so on.
      int getType()
      This method returns an int that represents the fixed constants defined in the Grid class.
      boolean isVisible() 
      void setVisible(boolean visible)

    • Constructor Detail

      • PowerUp

        public PowerUp(int x,
       int y)
        The superclass constructor. By calling this, the subclasses will pass in a location and any other class specific parameters they may have.
        Parameters:
        x - The x location of the item.
        y - The y location of the item.

    • Method Detail

      • getLocation

        public int getLocation()
        This method will return the x,y location of the Player object as a single integer between 1-81, where 1-9 is the first row, 10-18 is the second and so on.
        Returns:
        The location of the item as a single integer.

      • getType

        public int getType()
        This method returns an int that represents the fixed constants defined in the Grid class.
        Returns:
        The type of item as an int.
        See Also:
        Grid

        public boolean isVisible()

      • setVisible

        public void setVisible(boolean visible)
